page.title: 18Changes in the Area
page.content: Elderly people living between Ashford Hill and Kingsclere have seen many changes but comment that the scenery has not altered noticably in their lifetimes. Horses which once worked the farms disappeared but have come back in large numbers to cater for riding. Old cottages have been demolished in Union Lane and not replaced but new bungalows have been built.A small light industrial site is planned at the Kingsclere end near a roundabout constructed where the by-pass begins. The by-pass has relieved Kingsclere Village of heavy traffic but spoilt the peace and quiet for others living nearby.
